DataElement.preferredName: Diffusion Weighted Magnetic Resonance Imaging Method Cateogry
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Categorization of in vivo images of biological tissues weighted with local microstructural characteristics of water diffusion.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diffusion Weighted Magnetic Resonance Imaging Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The movement of chemical species under the influence of a concentration difference and as a result of random thermal agitation.  The species will move from the high concentration area to the low concentration area till the concentration is uniform in the whole phase._The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity._Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. _A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Diffusion Weighted Magnetic Resonance Imaging Cateogry
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The movement of chemical species under the influence of a concentration difference and as a result of random thermal agitation.  The species will move from the high concentration area to the low concentration area till the concentration is uniform in the whole phase._The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity._(mag-NET-ik REZ-o-nans IM-a-jing) MRI. A procedure in which a magnet linked to a computer is used to create detailed pictures of areas inside the body.  Also called nuclear magnetic resonance imaging._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.
